markdown:
**[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 31 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26 [Bog Mummy Cultist](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2242) **Source** [Kingmaker Adventure Path](/Sources.aspx?ID=150) pg. 102 **Perception** +19; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=40) (imprecise) 30 feet **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +19, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +18 **Str** +6 **Dex** +3 **Con** +4 **Int** +0 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +3 **Items** _+1 [cold-resistant](/Equipment.aspx?ID=283) [leather armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=4)_ --- **AC** 28 **Fort** +19 **Ref** +16 **Will** +21 **HP** 135 ([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) **Resistances** cold 5, [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72) 10 **Weaknesses** [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27) 10 **Breath of the Bog** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 30 feet. A creature that begins its turn within the area feels as if its lungs were filling with water and must succeed at a DC 25 Fortitude save or be unable to speak or [breathe](/Rules.aspx?ID=468). The creature can hold its breath and can attempt a new save at the end of its turn. A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to breath of the bog for 24 hours.
**Rejuvenation** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) Unless the damage that destroys a bog mummy cultist is positive damage, necromantic energies rebuild its body from swamp muck 1 week later. If the uncompleted body is destroyed during that time, the process starts anew. Anyone who succeeds at a DC 26 [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) check to [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) realizes that a [_consecrate_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=8) ritual performed on the site that a bog mummy cultist was destroyed prevents its rejuvenation, the way positive damage prevents the rejuvenation from occurring.
**Rise Up** **Trigger** A creature walks on top of a bog mummy cultist that lies buried in the mud or peat below; **Requirements** Initiative has not yet been rolled; **Effect** The bog mummy automatically notices the creature and [Burrows](/Actions.aspx?ID=93) before rolling initiative. --- **Speed** 20 feet, burrow 15 feet **Melee** fist +19 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 2d8+10 plus bog rot **Divine Innate Spells** DC 28, attack +20 - **Cantrips (5th)** [Divine Lance](/Spells.aspx?ID=84) - **4th** [Divine Wrath](/Spells.aspx?ID=86), [Grim Tendrils](/Spells.aspx?ID=141) - **5th** [Crisis of Faith](/Spells.aspx?ID=55) **Bog Rot** ([Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [Disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [Negative](/Traits.aspx?ID=118)) This affliction can't be reduced below stage 1, nor can the damage from it be healed, until it's successfully treated with [_remove curse_](/Spells.aspx?ID=250) or a similar effect; the affliction can then be removed as normal for a disease. A creature killed by bog rot melts into a noxious sludge and can't be brought back to life except by a 7th-level [_resurrect_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=20) ritual or similar magic; **Saving Throw** DC 28 Fortitude; **Stage 1** carrier with no ill effect (1 minute); **Stage 2** 3d6 negative damage and [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3) (1 day)
name: Bog Mummy Cultist

text: Bog Mummy Cultist Recall Knowledge - Undead (Religion): DC 31 Unspecific Lore : DC 29 Specific Lore : DC 26 Bog Mummy Cultist Source Kingmaker Adventure Path pg. 102 Perception +19; darkvision, tremorsense (imprecise) 30 feet Languages Common, Necril Skills Athletics +19, Stealth +18 Str +6 Dex +3 Con +4 Int +0 Wis +6 Cha +3 Items +1 cold-resistant leather armor --- AC 28 Fort +19 Ref +16 Will +21 HP 135 (negative healing) Immunities death effects, disease, paralyzed, poison, unconscious Resistances cold 5, fire 10 Weaknesses cold 10 Breath of the Bog (aura, divine, enchantment, mental) 30 feet. A creature that begins its turn within the area feels as if its lungs were filling with water and must succeed at a DC 25 Fortitude save or be unable to speak or breathe. The creature can hold its breath and can attempt a new save at the end of its turn. A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to breath of the bog for 24 hours. Rejuvenation (divine, necromancy) Unless the damage that destroys a bog mummy cultist is positive damage, necromantic energies rebuild its body from swamp muck 1 week later. If the uncompleted body is destroyed during that time, the process starts anew. Anyone who succeeds at a DC 26 Religion check to Recall Knowledge realizes that a consecrate ritual performed on the site that a bog mummy cultist was destroyed prevents its rejuvenation, the way positive damage prevents the rejuvenation from occurring. Rise Up Reaction Trigger A creature walks on top of a bog mummy cultist that lies buried in the mud or peat below; Requirements Initiative has not yet been rolled; Effect The bog mummy automatically notices the creature and Burrows before rolling initiative. --- Speed 20 feet, burrow 15 feet Melee Single Action fist +19 (Agile), Damage 2d8+10 plus bog rot Divine Innate Spells DC 28, attack +20 - Cantrips (5th) Divine Lance - 4th Divine Wrath, Grim Tendrils - 5th Crisis of Faith Bog Rot (Curse, Disease, Divine, Necromancy, Negative) This affliction can't be reduced below stage 1, nor can the damage from it be healed, until it's successfully treated with remove curse or a similar effect; the affliction can then be removed as normal for a disease. A creature killed by bog rot melts into a noxious sludge and can't be brought back to life except by a 7th-level resurrect ritual or similar magic; Saving Throw DC 28 Fortitude; Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute); Stage 2 3d6 negative damage and clumsy 1 (1 day)
